Nakhmanson Gambit

Mar 24, 2025

The Nakhmanson Gambit is one of the most aggressive lines that white can take in the Italian Game. White looks to give up two pawns and a knight in exchange for rapid development and some deadly attacks on the black king. The opening usually starts with the moves: 1.e4 e5 2.Nf3 Nc6 3.Bc4 Nf6 4.d4 exd4 5.O-O Nxe4 6.Nc3 For this overview we will be looking the accepted lines after 6â€¦dxc3 7. Bxf7 Kxf7 8. Qd5+. In this line white has given up two pawns, a knight, and now a bishop all for the thrill of a devastating attack on the black king.

Duckduckgo results about Nakhmanson Gambit

Learn about the Nakhmanson Gambit, a chess opening for white that can be reached in several move orders, mainly from the Italian Game. See the mainline, the engine line, the decline lines and some tactical puzzles in this study.
